title: [K-12] Traffic Accident Severity Prediction Modeling Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, linear algebra, and fundamental machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Multi-task deep learning model development utilizing real traffic accident data and interpretability analysis

learning_goals: Design a system classifying traffic accident severity (casualty/property damage) into three levels using a multi-task deep learning model
Visualize and interpret model predictions by applying Layer-wise Relevance Propagation (LRP) techniques

Learners can complete two or more projects applying at least three data preprocessing techniques (missing value handling, normalization, categorical encoding) using Python, building linear regression and classification models with Scikit-learn, and evaluating performance using accuracy/precision/recall metrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
